intro: Aethionema munzurense, commonly known as the Mongolian rock cress, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Central Asia. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its compact rosette of narrow, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, bright yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought and extreme temperatures. Aethionema munzurense is part of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard family plants.
